snippet.title: EU and Pacific discuss new relationship
snippet.content: Former head of the World Trade Organisation, Pascal Lamy, is in the region to discuss the future of the Pacific's relationship with the European Union. Mr Lamy is advising the EU on how to frame the successor to the "Cotonou Agreement" which guides its partnership with African, Caribbean and Pacific islands countries. He's in Australia at the moment, after holding talks with a number of Pacific leaders, and he says when the existing deal expires in three years' time, the new agreement will be set against a backdrop of what many perceive as the United States decreasing involvement in the region, and the rise of China.
